intro: Neomanniophyton angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved neomanniophyton, is a member of the family Apocynaceae, characterized by its milky sap and showy flowers. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often arranged oppositely along the stem. Its flowers are usually clustered in umbels and feature five petals, with the lower one being larger and showy. The plant is noted for its ornamental value and has been the subject of botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
